final_poem:
The earth exhales in whispers soft,  
A thawing hush where frost once slept.  
The brook, unbound, its laughter coughs  
Through reeds that bend in morning light.  

Daffodils in golden swarms  
Unfurl their faces to the sun,  
While cherry blossoms, pink and warm,  
Drift down like snow on silent horns.  

The bees hum hymns to clover’s tune,  
And butterflies, in zigzag flight,  
Disturb the breeze with wings so soon  
To brush the petals of the night.  

The sky unbuttons its gray coat,  
And sunbeams spill through branches bare,  
A quilt of green where shadows float,  
And every root begins to dare.  

The world, a page turned fresh and bare,  
Now cradles hope in every stem—  
A season’s promise, sweet and rare,  
To bloom, to break, to wake, to dream.
